So We called them to account in the shape of fierce accountability, and seized them with such a severe torment as was never seen or even heard of

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So they tasted the evil consequence of their doings and their affair ended up in total loss

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Allah has prepared for them severe torment (in the Hereafter as well). So keep fearing Allah, O men of reason, you who have believed. No doubt it is you towards whom Allah has sent down the Reminder (the Qur’an)

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (And has also sent) the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him), who recites to you clear Verses so that he may take those who have believed and do pious deeds from darkness to light. And he who believes in Allah and does pious deeds, He will admit him to the Gardens with streams flowing under them. They will live in them forever. Indeed, Allah has (prepared) for him excellent sustenance

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Allah (alone) has created seven heavens and (brought about seven strata layer upon layer also whilst creating) the earth like them. And the command (i.e., phenomenon of coordination in the system of nature) continues to operate amongst them so that you may know that Allah has absolute power over everything, and that Allah has encompassed everything with His Knowledge (i.e., when scientific explorations will culminate, you will then perceive the glory of Allah’s power and His All-Encompassing knowledge as to how He has described the realities of His creation centuries before)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O (Esteemed) Prophet! Why do you forbid yourself (taking honey) which Allah has made lawful for you? (How well) you seek to please your wives! And Allah is Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O believers!) Indeed, Allah has prescribed for you how to dissolve your oaths (by atonement). And Allah is your Helper and Protector. And He is All-Knowing, Most Wise

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the Prophet (blessings and peace be upon him) secretly disclosed a matter to one of his wives, but when she mentioned it and Allah made it known to the Prophet (blessings and peace be upon him), then the Prophet reminded her of some part of it and overlooked (to inform) the rest of it. Then when the Prophet (blessings and peace be upon him) informed her of it (that she had disclosed that secret), she said: ‘Who has told you of that?’ The Prophet (blessings and peace be upon him) said: ‘The All-Knowing, All-Aware (Lord) has told me.

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: If you both turn to Allah in repentance, (that is better for you) because the hearts of both of you have inclined (towards the same), but if you help one another in this matter (that may annoy the Holy Prophet [blessings and peace be upon him]). So surely Allah is the One Who is his Friend and Helper and Jibril (Gabriel) and the most pious believers and after them (all) angels too are (his) helpers

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: If he divorces you, then it may well be that your Lord will give him in your place better wives than yourselves (who) will be obedient, true believers, submissive, penitent, worshippers, given to fasting, (some) formerly married and (some) virgins

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O believers! Safeguard yourselves and your families against a Fire whose fuel is men and stones. Appointed over it are strong and stern angels who do not disobey Allah in what He commands them. And they accomplish what they are ordered

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O disbelievers! Do not make any excuse Today. You will only be paid the reward of what you have been doing

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O believers! Turn towards Allah’s presence in perfect and most sincere repentance. Your Lord will certainly remove your sins from you, and admit you to the Gardens with streams flowing under them. On the Day when Allah will not slight (His) Prophet (blessings and peace be upon him) and those believers who are in his companionship (visibly or invisibly), their light will be moving fast (brightening) ahead of them and on their right side. They will be submitting: ‘O our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us. Surely, You have absolute power over everything.

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O (Esteemed) Prophet! Strive hard against the disbelievers and the hypocrites (who have initiated militancy, aggression, mischief and intrigues against you) and treat them strictly. And their abode is Hell. And what an evil abode that is

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Allah has described for disbelievers the example of Nuh’s (Noah’s) wife (Wahila) and Lut’s (Lot’s) wife (Wa‘ila). They were married to two of Our pious servants. But both of them betrayed them. So they could not help them before (the torment of) Allah, and it was said to them: ‘Both of you (women), enter Hell along with all who enter it.

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Allah has given for the believers the example of Pharaoh’s wife (Asiya, the daughter of Mazahim) when she submitted: ‘O my Lord, build a house for me in Paradise in Your presence, and deliver me from Pharaoh and his (evil) conduct, and also rescue me from the wrongdoing people.

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (the second example is given of) Maryam (Mary), the daughter of ‘Imran, who guarded well her chastity and purity. And We breathed Our Spirit into the sternal opening of (her) shirt. And she confirmed the commandments of her Lord and the (revealed) Books and she was of the obedient

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Blessed is He in Whose (Mighty) Hand is the kingdom (of all the worlds). And He enjoys perfect command over everything

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He Who has created death and life (so that) He may test you as to which of you is best in conduct. And He is Almighty, Most Forgiving

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He Who has created seven (or numerous) heavenly spheres corresponding to one another (layer upon layer). You will not find any irregularity and disproportion in the system of the creation of the Most Kind (Lord). So have a (meditative and thoughtful) look around: do you find in this (creation) any incongruity or disharmony (i.e., degeneration or falling apart)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Look around time and again with (an inquisitive) vision (from different angles and with scientific methods. Every time) your sight will return to you fatigued and frustrated (in finding any shortcoming or imperfection)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And surely, We have adorned the lowest heaven of the universe with lights (in the form of stars, planets, other asteroids and meteoroids). And We have also made (some of them) the means of pelting away (i.e., eliminating the negative effects of) satans (i.e., rebellious forces). And We have prepared for these (satans) a torment of Blazing Fire

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And for those who have denied their Lord is the torment of Hell. And what an evil abode it is

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When they will be flung into it, they will hear its horrifying roar. And that (Fire) will be boiling (with rage)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: As if it is about to burst into pieces with intense wrath. When a group will be cast into it, its guards will ask them: ‘Did no Warner come to you?

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will say: ‘Yes indeed! A Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said: Allah has not sent down anything. You are just in great error.

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they will say: ‘Had we listened to or understood (the truth), we would not have been (put) amongst the inmates of Hell (Today).

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then they will confess their sin. So remoteness for the inmates of Hell (from Allah’s mercy) is (destined)

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is forgiveness and great reward

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And whether you speak in secret or aloud, certainly He knows best (even) the things (hidden) in the hearts

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Does He, Who has created, not know? In truth, He is the One Who can see the essence and is Well Aware (of everything)

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He is the One Who has made the earth soft and subservient to you. So walk about through its tracks and eat of the sustenance (given) by Him, and towards Him alone is the return, rising (after death)

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have you gone fearless of (the Lord of) the heaven that He may sink you into the earth when it suddenly shakes

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have you gone fearless of (the Lord of) the heaven that He may send against you a stone-pelting wind? Then soon will you come to know how My Warning is

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And surely, those before them (also) denied. But how (awful) proved My denial

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and (sometimes) folding them? Nothing can hold them (from falling) except (the law made by) the Most Kind (Lord). Surely, He sees everything best

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Well, is there anyone that can muster an army to help you against the Most Kind Lord? The disbelievers are merely (snared) in deception

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Well, is there anyone that can provide you sustenance if (Allah) holds back His sustenance (from you)? In fact, they are adamantly fixed in rebellion and hatred (for truth)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Is he who walks in prone position more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘(Allah) is He Who created you and provided you with ears and eyes and hearts. Yet you give thanks but little.

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘He is the One Who has spread you in the earth, and you will be gathered towards Him (on the Day of Assembly).

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they say: ‘When will this promise (of the Day of Resurrection) be fulfilled if you are truthful?

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘The knowledge (of that Hour) is with Allah alone and I am just a clear Warner.’ (If the time is disclosed, there will be no fear any more.

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then, when they will see that (Day) near, the faces of the disbelievers will be deformed and darkened, and it will be said (to them): ‘This is (the promise) which you asked for (to come to pass in haste).

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘Well, give your view: if Allah causes me death (as you desire) and (also) to my Companions, or shows mercy to us (i.e., defers our death), then (in both these cases) who will shelter the disbelievers from the painful torment?

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘He alone is the Most Kind (Lord) in Whom we believe and in Whom we trust. So you will soon know who is in open error.

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘If your water sinks far deep into the earth (i.e., dries up), then who will bring you flowing water (on earth)?

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nun. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.) By the pen and by that (subject) which (the angels) write down

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O Esteemed Beloved!) By the Grace of your Lord, you are not (at all) insane

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And assuredly, for you there is a reward that will never end

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And assuredly, you are placed high on the Most Glorious and Exalted (seat of) character (i.e., adorned with the Qur’anic morality and endowed with the character traits of Allah)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Soon you will see and they (too) will see

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: As to which of you is mad

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, your Lord knows him best who has strayed from the straight path and (also) knows best those who are rightly guided

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So do not agree with what the beliers say

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They wish that you should become (needlessly) flexible (in the matter of the Din [Religion]). Then they too would show flexibility

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And do not agree with any vile, most mean swearer of oaths

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The one who is) a slanderer, fault-finder, mischief-monger, (and) who backbites the people to rouse strife

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The one who) greatly hinders pious works and is a miser, rebellious transgressor (and) toughened sinner

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The one who is) rude, unmannerly, crooked and moreover of doubtful birth.

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So (do not pay any heed to him) because he is wealthy and has children

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says: ‘These are the fictitious stories of the bygone people.

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Now We shall brand him on the snout

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, We will try them (the inhabitants of Mecca in the same way) as We tried (in Yemen) the owners of the garden when they swore that they would surely pluck its fruit the next morning

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they did not make any exception (saying ‘if Allah wills’ or for the share of the orphans)

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So a whirl (of disaster) from your Lord went round (that garden during the night) whilst they were asleep

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, that (waving fruit-laden garden) became a harvested field in the morning

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then as the day dawned, they started calling out one another

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: ‘Leave early for your tilth if you want to pick the fruit.

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So they set off whispering to one another

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: ‘Do not let any pauper come near you in the garden today.

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And early in the morning they left, (feeling) quite competent to execute their plan (of getting the yield and depriving the poor of their share)

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then when they saw that (ruined garden), they said: ‘We must have lost our way; (this is not our garden).

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (But when they saw it cautiously, they cried: ‘Oh no!) We have been deprived indeed.

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: One of them, wise and inclined to the balanced judgment, said: ‘Did I not say to you: Why do you not glorify and remember Allah?

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Then) they said: ‘Our Lord is Holy. Surely, it is we who were the wrongdoers.

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, blaming and maligning, they turned to one another

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They said: ‘Woe to us! No doubt it is we who were disobedient and rebellious

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: We hope that our Lord may give us something better than this in exchange. Verily, we turn to our Lord.

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Such is the punishment. And truly, the torment of the Hereafter is far greater (than this). Would that they only knew

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, for the Godfearing there are Gardens of Bliss with their Lord

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Shall We (deprive) the obedient like the disobedient

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: What is the matter with you? How do you make a judgment

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Do you have any Book with you in which you read (this)

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That it contains all that you like

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Or have you any (such) firm covenants from Us as will subsist till the Day of Resurrection (by means of which We are bound) that you will be provided with whatever you shall decide (for yourselves)

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Ask them which of them will vouch for such (a baseless assertion)

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Or do they have any partners (as well)? Then they should bring their partners if they are truthful

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The Day when the ‘shin’ (i.e., the terrifying fierceness of the Hour of Rising) will be laid bare, and (the disobedient) people will be called to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to do so (i.e., to prostrate themselves)

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Their eyes will be cast down (with terror and shame) and disgrace will be spreading over them, whereas they were called to prostrate themselves (in the world also) when they were healthy (but they, even then, refused to fall prostrate)

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, (O Esteemed Beloved,) leave Me (to exact revenge) from the one who rejects this Revelation. Now We shall take them (towards disaster) so gradually that they will not perceive it

45.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And I am giving them respite. Surely, My strategy is unbeatable

46.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Do you ask them for any reward (for preaching the faith in Messengership) that they are weighed down with (the burden of) paying the recompense

47.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Do they have the knowledge of the unseen that they write down (their judgments on the basis of that)

48.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So be steadfast in waiting for the command of your Lord, and do not (take it to your heart) like (Yunus [Jonah], the Messenger with) fish episode, when he cried out (to Allah) in a state pent up with rage and grief (against his community)

49.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Had the mercy and blessing of his Lord not helped him, he would certainly have been thrown in the barren field, blamed. (But Allah saved him from that.

50.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then his Lord exalted him and (placed him) amongst the perfectly pious (blessing him with His exceptional nearness)

51.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And indeed, when the disbelievers listen to the Qur’an, it seems as if they wish to damage you with their (jealously evil) looks and say: ‘He is insane.

52.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And it (the Qur’an) is direction and guidance for all the worlds

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The surely Inevitable Hour

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: What is the surely Inevitable Hour

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what has made you alert what (calamity) surely is the Inevitable Hour

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Thamud and ‘Ad rejected the (calamity of a) Shattering Gravitational Collision (of all the existent cosmic bodies)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, as for the people of Thamud, they were destroyed by the extremely violent, Deafening Blast

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And as for the people of ‘Ad, they (too) were destroyed by a violently cold, roaring gale

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Allah made that (gale) seize them for consecutive seven nights and eight days. So, you could see them lying dead (during that time as if) they were hollow roots of the uprooted palm trees

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So do you see any of them surviving

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Pharaoh and those before him and (the dwellers of) the overthrown towns (of the community of Lut [Lot]) committed grave sins

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So they (also) disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord. And Allah seized them with a mighty seizure

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, when the water (of the Deluge) overflowed the limit, We carried you in the floating Ark

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that We make this (episode a reminding) lesson of warning for you and that the retentive ears may retain it

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then when the Trumpet will be blown once

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the earth and mountains will be removed (from their places), they will then be crushed to sand particles in a single crash

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then that will be the Hour when the surely Inevitable (calamity) will occur

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (all) the heavenly bodies will split apart and this universe will come to comprise (black) holes (by means of a force which coordinates and keeps the system going).

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the angels will be standing on its edges and above them that Day, and eight (angels or parties of angels) will be carrying the Throne of your Lord

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That Day you will be made to appear (for reckoning). Nothing of your secrets will remain hidden

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So the one who will be given his record in the right hand will say (pleased): ‘Come and read my record

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: I firmly believed that I would find my account (easy).

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So he will live a pleasant life

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: In an elevated lofty Paradise

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The clusters of its fruits hanging low (due to abundance)

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It will be said to them:) ‘Eat and drink rejoicing, in recompense of (your deeds) that you had sent forward during the days of your past (life).

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And as for him who will be given his record in his left hand, he will say: ‘Would that I had not been given my record

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And would that I had not known about my account

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Alas! Would that (death) had settled my affair once and for all

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Today my wealth has not been able to keep (the torment) away from me even a little

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: My power and domain have (also) gone from me.

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It will be commanded:) ‘Seize him and put him in neck-fetter

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then cast him into Hell

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then bind him tightly in a seventy yard long chain

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Verily, he did not believe in Allah, the Lord of Majesty

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So Today he does not have any warm friend

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor has he anything to eat except filthy pus

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That no one will eat except the sinners.

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So I swear by the things that you see

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by those things that you do not see

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Assuredly, this (Qur’an) is the (God-sent) commandment of the Exalted and Glorious Messenger ([blessings and peace be upon him] which he expounds as a Messenger and as a Vicegerent)

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And it is not the poetry of a poet (composed with literary expertise). You have but little faith

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor is it the word of a fortune-teller (designed by skilful guesswork). You take but little advice

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (This) is sent down by the Lord of all the worlds

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And had he ascribed to Us even a (single) fabricated thing

45.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: We would have seized him with full force and might

46.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then certainly We would have cut his life artery

47.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then no one of you could have held (Us) back from it

48.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So no doubt this (Qur’an) is direction and guidance for the Godfearing

49.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And surely, We know that some of you are the beliers (of this open truth)

50.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And surely, this is (a cause of) bitter regret for the disbelievers

51.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And undeniably, it is the truth of Absolute Certitude

52.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, (O Esteemed Beloved,) glorify your Lord, Most Magnificent, with persistence

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: A questioner asked for the torment which is sure to come about

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Upon the disbelievers, which no one can repel

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (That will befall) from Allah, Who is the Lord of the Ascending Steps to Heaven (and of the higher ranks and grades of spiritual hierarchy)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The angels and al-Ruh al-Amin (the Spirit) rise towards His (Throne) in a Day which measures fifty thousand years (according to the worldly scale).

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, (O Beloved,) observe patience (on the assertions of the disbelievers) without regrets

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, they imagine that (Day) to be far off

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But We see it very near

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day the sky will become like molten copper

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the mountains like (flakes of) coloured wool

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And no friend will enquire after his friend

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Though) they will be shown (to one another). The sinner would desire to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by his children

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (by giving) his wife and his brother

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (all) his family who used to provide him shelter

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And all the people on earth (as recompense for himself), so that this (atonement) may save him from (Allah’s torment)

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But no! By no means! Surely, that is a Flaming Fire

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Stripping off the skin of all the limbs and the scalp

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is calling him who turned his back (on the truth) and turned away

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (he who) accumulated wealth and then held it (from distribution)

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, man has been created impatient and greedy

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He gets upset and worried when some hardship (or financial loss) afflicts him

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But becomes miserly when he receives good fortune (or affluence)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except for those who offer Prayer

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And are constant in their Prayer

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those (who are committed to sacrifice and) in whose wealth there is a fixed share

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Of one who begs and of one who is needy but does not beg

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who affirm the Day of Requital

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who fear the torment of their Lord

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the torment of their Lord is not a thing which should not be feared

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who safeguard their private parts

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except from their wives or the female slaves they possess. So (in this) there is no blame on them

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But he who looks for more than that, then it is they who transgress the limits

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who safeguard their trusts and promises

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who stand firm on their testimonies

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those who safeguard their Prayers

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is they who will enjoy great honour and respect in the Gardens

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So what is the matter with the disbelievers that they are coming towards you running

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: From the right as well as the left, in groups

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Does every one of them hope that he may be admitted to the Garden of Bliss (without faith and deeds)

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Certainly not! Surely, We have created them from a substance which they (also) know

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that surely We have Absolute Power

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: To replace them with people better than them and We are not at all incapable (of doing it)

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So leave them occupied with their absurd talk and pastime until they meet that Day of theirs which they have been promised

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The Day when they will come forth from their graves in haste as if they are running towards the temples of their idols

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Their plight) will be that their eyes will be cast down (with shame and fear) and disgrace enveloping them. It is this Day which they were promised

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people: ‘Warn your people before a painful torment comes upon them.

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He said: ‘O my people! Indeed, I am a clear Warner to you

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That you must worship Allah and fear Him and obey me

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He will forgive your sins and will give you respite till an appointed term. Surely, when (the appointed) time of Allah comes, then respite is not given if only you knew.

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nuh (Noah) submitted: ‘O my Lord! Indeed, I kept calling my people night and day

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But my calling did no good except making them flee away

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And every time I called them (towards faith) so that You might forgive them, they only thrust their fingers into their ears and wrapped their clothes over themselves and stuck obstinately (to disbelief) and behaved most arrogantly

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then I called them aloud

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then I advised them publicly and privately and secretly (as well)

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then I said: ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Surely, He is Most Forgiving

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He will send down on you torrents of rain

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And will help you with wealth and sons and will grow for you gardens and will make streams flow for you

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: What is the matter with you that you do not have faith in, or the gnosis of, Allah’s Majesty

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Whereas He has created you through diverse conditions

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have you not seen how Allah has created seven (or many) heavenly spheres corresponding to one another (layer upon layer)

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And He brightened in them the moon and made the sun a radiant lamp (i.e., the source of light and heat)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Allah has caused you to grow like vegetation from the earth.

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then He will return you into the same (earth) and will then bring you forth (from the same again)

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Allah has made the earth a vast expanse for you

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that you may move around through its broad ways.

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nuh (Noah) submitted: ‘O my Lord! They have disobeyed me and kept following that (class of the rebellious rich) whose wealth and children have not increased for them anything but loss

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they kept perpetrating huge frauds (to keep the common man in error)

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they kept saying: Do not turn away from your gods and never abandon (the idols named as) Wadd, Suwa‘, Yaghuth, Ya‘uq and Nasr (as well)

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And truly, they have misled many people. So, (O my Lord,) do not increase these wrongdoers (in anything) except misguidance.

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (In the end) they were drowned due to their sins and then flung into Fire. So they could not find any helper for themselves against Allah

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Nuh (Noah) submitted: ‘O my Lord! Do not leave even a single disbeliever living on earth

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, if You leave them (alive), they will keep leading your servants astray and will beget none but the most wicked and extremely disbelieving children

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O my Lord! Forgive me and my parents and everyone who enters my home as a believer and (all) the believing men and the believing women, and do not increase anything for the wrongdoers except destruction.

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘It has been revealed to me that a party of the jinn listened to (my recitation) carefully and then (went back to their people and) said: Surely, we have heard a wonderful Qur’an

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It shows the path of guidance. So we have believed in it and will never set up any partner with our Lord

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that exalted is the Glory of our Lord. He has taken for Himself neither any wife nor any children

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that only a fool from amongst us used to utter things about Allah far from the truth, crossing bounds

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that we thought that man and jinn would never tell a lie against Allah

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that some of the men used to take shelter with some of the jinn. So they increased defiance amongst the jinn

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And, (O party of jinn,) those men also thought just as you thought that Allah would never raise up anyone (after death)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that we touched the heavens and found them filled with high-alert guards and stars shining and burning (like brands)

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that we used to sit on certain seats (in the heavens previously, to listen to the news), but if someone now seeks to listen, then he will find a flame of fire (waiting) for him in ambush

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that we do not know whether some evil has been intended (by our restriction) in respect of those people who are in the earth, or their Lord intends some good for them

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that amongst us are some who are pious and there are also some (evil) exceptions amongst us. We were (following) different ways

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And we have ascertained that we can by no means come in the way of Allah (whilst living) in the earth, nor can we thwart Him by escaping (from the earth)

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that when we listened to (the Book of) Guidance, we believed in it. Then he who believes in his Lord fears neither loss nor injustice

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that (some) of us are obedient and (some) of us are wrongdoers as well. So he who becomes obedient, it is they who seek righteousness

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And as for the wrongdoers, they will be the fuel of Hell.

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And this (Revelation has also come to me) that if they had remained firm on the right path (the path of truth, the path of the remembrance of Allah), then We would have provided them with abundant water

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that We put them to trial by this blessing. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to enter a severe torment

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that mosques are (specified) for Allah alone. So never worship anyone else besides Allah

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And that when the servant of Allah (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]) stood up to worship Him, they thronged around him (to listen to his recitation)

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘I worship only my Lord and do not associate any partner with Him.

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘I do not possess any power to do you harm (i.e., make you disbelieve) or to do you good (i.e., make you believe. So Allah is the real Lord. I am a mediator and means).

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘Neither can anyone shelter me from a torment (against the command) of Allah, nor can I ever find refuge apart from Him

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But (my responsibility is) to communicate from Allah His commands and messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him), surely there is for him the Fire of Hell in which they will live forever.

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Until, when they will see that torment which is being promised to them, (then) they will come to know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘I do not know whether that (Day of Rising) which is being promised to you is near, or my Lord has appointed a longer term for that.

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (He is) the Knower of the unseen. So He does not inform any (common man) of His unseen

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except for His Messengers with whom He is well-pleased (and reveals to them alone the unseen because that is an exclusive trait of Prophethood and a Messenger’s miracle as well). So indeed He appoints protectors at both front and rear of him (the Messenger, for the security of the knowledge of the unseen)

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that Allah may bring to light that surely they (the Messengers) have communicated the messages of their Lord, and Allah has (already) encompassed what they have (of Allah’s injunctions and the knowledge of the unseen) and He has kept count of everything

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O mantled (Beloved!

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Rise and stand (in Prayer) at night but (for) a short while

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Half the night or decrease it a little

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Or increase a little more to it. And recite the Qur’an with most pleasant pauses

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Soon We shall send down to you a burdensome command

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No doubt rising at night strictly subdues (the ill-commanding self), and makes the tongue deliver straight and clear speech (with the concentration of head and heart)

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Of course, there are many commitments for you during the day

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And continue remembering the Name of your Lord, devoted completely to Him alone (in your heart and soul), broken away from everyone else

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He is the Lord of the east and the west. There is no God but He. So take Him alone as (your) Guardian

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And observe patience with what they (disbelievers) utter and turn aside from them in a fine manner

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And leave Me (to deal) with the denying rich money-mongers (to take revenge). And give them a little respite (so that their evil deeds may cross the limit)

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, We have heavy shackles and the Blazing Fire (of Hell)

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And food that chokes the throat and most painful torment

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The Day when the earth and the mountains shall shake violently and mountains will turn into heaps of flying away sand

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, We have sent towards you a Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) who bears witness to you (seeing thoroughly your states of being) as We sent a Messenger towards Pharaoh

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So Pharaoh disobeyed that Messenger, and We seized him with a devastating seizure

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: If you continue disbelieving, then how will you save yourselves from (the torment of) that Day which will turn the children old

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The Day) by whose severity the heaven will be split apart? His promise is bound to be fulfilled

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Verily, this (Qur’an) is an admonition. So let him who desires adopt the way to reach his Lord

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, your Lord knows that you stand (for prayer sometimes) about two-thirds of the night and (sometimes) half the night and (sometimes) a third of the night, and (also) a party of those who are with you (join in standing up for Prayer). And Allah is the One Who keeps the true measure (of increasing or decreasing) the night and the day. He knows that you just do not have the power to encompass it so He granted you forgiveness (by reducing the toil). So recite the Qur’an as much as is easy for you. He knows that (some of) you will be ill and (some) others will be travelling in the land to look for Allah’s bounty and (still some) others will be fighting in the way of Allah. So recite as much as is easy for you. And establish Prayer and pay Zakat (the Alms-due) and lend Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you will send forward for yourselves, you will find it in the presence of Allah much better and in reward still greater. And keep seeking forgiveness from Allah. Allah is Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O enwrapped (Beloved!

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Rise and give warning (to the people)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And glorify the Greatnesss (and Majesty) of your Lord

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (always) keep your (visible and spiritual) attire purified and cleansed (as before)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And keep away from the idols (and sins as usual)

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And do not do a favour (to anyone with the purpose of) seeking more from him

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And observe patience for the sake of your Lord

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then when the Trumpet will be blown (a second time)

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that Day (the Day of Resurrection) will be an extremely hard day

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Not at all easy for the disbelievers

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Leave Me (to take revenge) on him whom I have created alone

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And I provided him wealth in abundance

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (gave) him sons remaining present (before him)

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And granted him affluence (in sources of luxury)

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yet he desires that I should give him more

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No way! He has certainly been inimical to Our Revelations

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Soon I shall afflict him with (the punishment of) a severe toil

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, he reflected and devised a plot

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So let (Allah’s) curse be on him! How he plotted

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Let again (Allah’s) curse be on him! How he plotted

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he pondered (over his scheme again)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he frowned and twisted his face

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he turned back (from the truth) and showed arrogance

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he said: ‘This (Qur’an) is nothing but magic which is being transmitted from the past (magicians)

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This (Qur’an) is nothing (else) but the words of a human being.

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: I will soon cast him into Hell

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And who has told you what Saqar (the Fire of Hell) is

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That (is the Fire which) does not spare, nor does it leave out

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (That) scorches the skin and blackens it

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: There are nineteen (angels appointed as guards) over it

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We have appointed only angels as guards of Hell. And We have fixed their number only as a trial for the disbelievers so that the People of the Book may believe with certitude (that the Qur’an and the Prophethood of Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him] is a truth because the same number was given in their scriptures as well), and that the faith of the believers may further be strengthened (with this confirmation), and that the People of the Book and the believers may not doubt (its veracity), and that those having a disease (of hypocrisy) in their hearts and the disbelievers may say: ‘What does Allah intend by this example (of number)?’ In this way, Allah holds astray whom He wills, and guides aright whom He wills (with the same stroke). And no one knows the armies of your Lord except Him. And this (description of Hell is nothing else) but an admonition to mankind

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yes! By the moon (whose increase, decrease and disappearance is evidence)

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the night when it backs away to depart

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the morning when it brightens

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, this (Hell) is one of the greatest calamities

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is a warning to mankind

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For any of you who seeks to advance forward (in piety) or who lags behind (trapped in evil)

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Everyone is held in pledge for (the deeds) that he has earned

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except for those on the Right Side

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (They) will be in Gardens and will be asking one another

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: About the evildoers

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (And they will say:) ‘What has brought you into Hell?

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will say: ‘We were not of those who used to offer Prayers

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor did we feed the poor

45.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And we indulged in vain activities with those who had cast themselves into vain activities

46.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And we rejected the Day of Reward and Punishment

47.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Until that (death), which was certain to come, came upon us.

48.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So (now) the intercession of the intercessors will not be of any benefit to them

49.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then what is the matter with these (disbelievers that even then) they turn away from the Reminder

50.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: As if they were startled (wild) donkeys

51.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Fleeing away from a lion

52.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: In fact, every one of them desires that he should be given (directly) open scrolls of (heavenly) scriptures

53.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That is not possible at all. Rather (the fact is that) they fear not the Last Day

54.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: There is no doubt that this (Qur’an) is a Reminder

55.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So whoever wills may remember it

56.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they will not remember (it) unless Allah so wills. He is the One to Whom fear (and righteousness) is due, and He alone is the Lord of forgiveness

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: I swear by the Day of Resurrection

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And I swear by the blaming self, reproaching (itself for evil deeds)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Does man think We shall not at all collect his bones (which will decompose into dust particles after his death)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yes, of course! We have also the power to restore and set right even his finger joints and finger tips

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yet man still wants to continue committing sins also (in the life to come)

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He asks (scornfully): ‘When is the Day of Resurrection?

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But when the eyes will be dazzled

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the moon will be eclipsed

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the sun and the moon will be fused (i.e., darkened) together

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day man will cry out: ‘Where to flee away?

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No indeed! There is no place of refuge

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The place of refuge and repose that Day will be with your Lord alone

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That Day man will be informed of those (deeds) which he sent forward and those (repercussions) which he left behind (after his death)

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: In truth, man will (himself) be aware of (the affairs of) his self

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Even though he will offer all his excuses

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O Beloved!) Do not move your tongue in a hurry (to learn the Qur’an by heart when it is revealed to you)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Assuredly, upon Us rests its collection and preservation (in your breast) and its recitation (by your tongue)

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So when We complete its recitation (by the tongue of Jibril [Gabriel]), then follow that recitation

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then surely upon Us is the clear exposition (of its implications)

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The truth is, (O disbelievers,) that you love (the world) which you can readily gain

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And you have left aside the Hereafter

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Many faces will be fresh and in full bloom that Day

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Beholding (the enchanting radiance and beauty of) their Lord (unveiled)

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And many faces will be deformed (depressed and dark) that Day

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Thinking that they will be subjected to such a harsh treatment that will break their backbones

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No indeed! When the soul reaches the throat

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And it is said: ‘Who can (now) treat him with magic (to cure him)?

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (the departing soul) comes to realize that (now) is the hour of parting (with all)

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And one leg clings to the other

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Towards your Lord is the departure that Day

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So (how ill-fated is he that) he neither affirmed (what the Messenger said) nor offered Prayer

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Rather he kept belying and turning away

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he went off towards his family in arrogance

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to you (when dying), then woe to you (in the grave)

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then again woe to you (on the Last Day), then woe to you (in Hell)

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Does man think that he will be left for nothing (without any reckoning)

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Was he not (in his beginning) a sperm drop ejaculated (into the woman’s womb)

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then it developed into a hanging mass (clinging to the womb like a nest). Then He created (in it the preliminary form of all the limbs of the body). Then He set (them) right

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then He made from the same sperm drop two genders: male and female

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then has He not the power to give life to the dead again

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, there has passed over man a period of time when he was not a thing worth mentioning

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, We created man from a fertilized ovum that We keep turning and examining (from one stage to the next till birth). So We have made him (in the order of) hearing (then) seeing

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, We also showed him the way (to understanding and insight for distinguishing between the truth and falsehood) whether he (now) becomes thankful or continues to be ungrateful

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains (for the feet), neck-fetters and the Blazing Fire (of Hell)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the sincerely devoted and obedient will drink from the cups (of the holy drink) mixed with kafur (to enhance its aroma, colour and taste)

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Kafur is) a spring (in Paradise) that (the privileged) servants of Allah (i.e., Awliya’ Allah) will drink from, and will (also) make it flow to wherever they will desire in the form of small brooks (to make others drink of it)

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (These privileged servants of Allah are those) who fulfil their vows and keep fearing that Day whose severity spreads afar

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they give (their own) food, in deep love of Allah, to the needy, the orphan and prisoner (out of sacrifice, despite their own desire and need for it)

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (And say:) ‘We are feeding you only to please Allah. We do not seek any recompense from you nor (wish for) any thanks

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: We fear from our Lord the Day which will make (the faces) look very dark (and) ugly.

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So Allah will save them from the terror of that Day (for their fear of Allah) and will grant them freshness, bloom and blush (on their faces) and ecstasy and delight (in their hearts)

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And will bless them with Gardens (to live in) and silky clothes (to wear), a reward for their patience

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Reclining in it against cushions on raised couches, they will find there neither intense cold nor heat

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the shades (of trees in Paradise) will close upon them, and the bunches of their (fruits) will be hanging low

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (the servants) will go round them with vessels of silver and (pure and clean) goblets of shining glass

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And glasses made of silver which they will have filled with exact measures (according to everyone’s desire)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they will be made to drink there cups of (the holy drink) mixed with Zanjabil

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Zanjabil is) a spring in this (Paradise) named Salsabil

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And going round them will be (innocent) adolescents who will remain ever-young. When you will see them, you will consider them as scattered pearls

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when you will look (at Paradise), you will find blessings (in abundance) and a mighty kingdom (all around)

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will be clad in green, fine silk and rich brocade attire, and they will be made to wear silver bracelets, and their Lord will make them drink a holy beverage

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, that will be your reward and your hard work is acknowledged

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, We have revealed the Qur’an to you piecemeal

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So (continue to) be patient for the sake of your Lord’s command and do not give your ear to any liar, sinner or disbeliever or thankless person from amongst them

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And prostrate yourself before His presence for some hours of the night, and glorify Him during (the rest of) the long hours of the night

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, these (world-mongers) love the gains that are achievable right away. And they have put behind their backs (the remembrance of) the very hard Day

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (They do not realize that) We alone have created them and have made their every joint strong, and We can replace them whenever We may please with the people like them

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, this (Qur’an) is a Reminder. So whoever desires may adopt the way to (reach) his Lord

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And you cannot wish anything yourselves except what Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He admits whom He wills to (the circle of) His mercy, and He has prepared a grievous torment for the wrongdoers

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By the soft blowing, pleasant breezes which blow in succession

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then by the violent winds which blow with fierce gusts

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by those which spread the clouds all around

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then by those which split (them) apart and break them off

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then by those which bring direction and guidance

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: To accomplish the argument or to warn

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the promise (of the Last Day) which is being given to you will be certainly fulfilled

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then when the light of the stars will be extinguished

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the heavenly universe will be split open

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the mountains will be (broken down to dust) and blown off

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the Messengers will be brought together at the appointed time (to bear witness to their respective communities)

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Well, for what Day is the term (of all the affairs) appointed

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For the Day of Judgment

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And who has told you what the Day of Judgment is

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe (and devastation) to the deniers on that Day

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Did We not destroy the people (who denied) before

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then We also cause the later ones to follow them (in destruction)

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This is how We sort out (the matter) with the evildoers

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Did We not create you from (a drop) of detestable fluid

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then We placed it in a secure place (i.e., the mother’s womb)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Till an appointed period (of time)

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then We determined time periods (for all the stages of growth from conception to birth). And how excellent do We determine

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have We not made the earth an assembling expanse

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (That draws together) the living (as well as) the dead

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We placed on it soaring high and firm mountains, and gave you sweet water to drink (from springs of sweet, fresh water)

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Now) move on to that (torment) which you used to deny

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Proceed towards that shadow (of the smoke of Hell) that forks into three columns

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: A shadow which is neither cool nor protecting against the heat of Fire

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, that (Hell) throws up sparks and flames (huge) as a lofty palace

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It also appears) as if those (sparks) are yellow camels

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This is a Day (on which) they will not be able to speak too

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor will they be allowed to offer any excuses

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This is the Day of Judgment (on which) We shall gather you and (all) the earlier communities

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then if you have any scheme (and trick to escape from the torment), try (that) against Me

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe (i.e., dejection) to the deniers on that Day

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the Godfearing will be (rejoicing) under cool shades and amid springs

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And whatever fruits they will long for (will be available for them)

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It will be said to them:) ‘Enjoy eating and drinking to your taste as a reward for what you used to do.

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, the same way do We reward the pious

45.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

46.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O deniers of the truth!) Eat and enjoy yourselves for a short while. No doubt, you are the evildoers

47.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

48.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when it is said to them: ‘Bow down (before Allah),’ they do not bow

49.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

50.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then in what revelation after this (Qur’an) will they believe

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: What is (it) they are questioning about one another

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Are they asking) of the Great News

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: About which they differ

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (That News is) not at all (deniable). They will soon know (that reality)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (We) once more (assert: Dissent and denial are) in no way (right). They will come to know soon

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have We not made the earth a place to stay for (life) and to earn living and deeds

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (have We not) erected mountains raised (out of it)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (ponder:) We (have) created you in pairs (for reproduction)

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We (have) made your sleep (a means of bodily) rest

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We (have) made the night a covering (by virtue of its darkness)

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We (have) made the day (a time) for (earning) livelihood

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (now study the spatial universe as well). We built above you seven strong (firmaments)

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We made (the sun a massive) fountainhead of light and heat

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We poured water in torrents from rain-laden clouds

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So that by means of this (downpour), We bring forth (from the earth) grain and vegetation

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (grow) thick gardens

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Observing these signs of Our Might, know that) the Day of Judgment (i.e., Resurrection too) is certainly a fixed time

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will flock (in the holy presence of Allah) in droves

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the (layers of) heaven will be torn, and (owing to the rip) they will become (as if) all doors

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the mountains (after being reduced to dust) will be blown off (into the atmosphere); so they will be (eliminated like) a mirage

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, Hell is a place of ambush

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (That) is the abode of rebels

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will abide there for recurrent, infinite periods

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will taste in it neither coolness (of any sort) nor any drink

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except boiling water and suppurated fluid oozing (from the wounds of the inmates of Hell)

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: A compensation commensurate with (their revolt)

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For they had no fear of Reckoning (on the Last Day) in the least

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they used to utterly deny Our signs

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And We have preserved everything (major or minor) in writing

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O disbelievers, you excelled in rebellion and disbelief in the world.) Now taste the outcome (of your actions). We shall keep increasing but the torment upon you

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the Godfearing will triumph

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (For them) there will be gardens and grapes

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And well-matched young maidens

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And overflowing cups (of holy beverage)

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: There, these (people) will neither hear any foolish talk nor belie (one another)

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: From your Lord this is the reward which is an (amply) sufficient bestowal (in proportion to your works)

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He is the Lord of (all) the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Kind. (But on the Last Day, the effect and impact of His mighty power and most high authority will be such that) none (from His creation) will dare converse with Him

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That Day Gabriel (the Spirit of peace and security) and (all) angels will stand in ranks, none able to speak except he whom the Most Kind (Lord) would already have awarded sanction (to intercede) and who also said the right thing (in keeping with the teachings of Islam, during his life of the world)

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This is the Day of truth. So, whoever longs may obtain an abode (of mercy and nearness) in the presence of his Lord

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: We have, indeed, warned you of the impending torment. On that Day, everyone will see whatever (acts) he has sent ahead and (every) disbeliever will say: ‘Would that I were dust (and escaped this punishment)!

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By the (angels) who violently snatch out (the souls of the disbelievers from each tendon and ligament of their body), Or By the waves of energy that pierce into matter and break up the chemical bonds fiercely

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the (angels) who unweave sinews (of the believers’ organisms) gently and peacefully, Or By the waves of energy that disintegrate gently and peacefully the chemical bonds within matter

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the (angels) who swiftly glide (between the heavens and the earth), Or By the waves of energy that move around freely in space and atmosphere

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then by the (angels) who with burst of speed sprint past others, Or By the waves of energy that surpass other waves in speed, force and assimilation

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then by the (angels) who manage different affairs well, Or By the waves of energy that, through mutual dynamism and coordination, maintain equilibrium and keep the balance of the management going for the survival of the system of the universe

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (When they will be commanded to devastate the system of the universe) that Day, everything in motion (in the universe) will tremor into violent convulsion

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Chased by a succeeding convulsion

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That Day, hearts (of the people) will pound with agony and terror

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Their eyes will be downcast (with dread and horror)

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The disbelievers say: ‘Shall we be reverted to the former life

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Shall we be given life even) when we shall have become rotten (hollow) bones?

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They say: ‘This (return) would then be a losing return.

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then it will be rending (of all heavenly bodies) asunder with single extremely horrible explosion

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then they (all) will forgather suddenly in the open expanse (for assembly)

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Has the account of Musa (Moses) reached you

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When His Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (And commanded:) ‘Go to Pharaoh. He has transgressed all bounds.

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then say (to him): ‘Do you wish that you should be purified

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (do you desire that) I guide you to your Lord so that you may fear (Him)?

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then Musa (Moses) showed him the great sign

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But he denied it and disobeyed

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then, turning away (from the truth), he launched struggle (in rivalry against Musa [Moses])

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So he gathered (people) and started calling out

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And said: ‘I am your lord, most high.

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then Allah seized him in (dual) punishment of this world and the Hereafter

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, in this (incident) there is a great lesson of warning for him who fears (Allah)

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Is it you who are harder to create, or (the entire) galactic universe that He has built

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He raised high all the heavenly spheres (planets, after creating them in the infinite cosmos), then moderated, equipoised and stabilized (their composition, construction, functions and movements)

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And He is the One Who blackened the night of heavenly space (i.e., darkened the entire spatial environment like a murky night) and emitted (after creating) the light of these (planets from this space)

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And He is the One Who, later, (after the creation of the planet sun) separated (from it) the earth, flung it with centrifugal force (and spread its expanse to make it inhabitable)

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He is the One Who drew water from the earth (separately), and brought forth its vegetable kingdom (from the rest of the dry regions)

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And He is the One Who (putting together different elements) raised from the earth firmly fixed mountains

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (He did all this) for the benefit of you and your livestock

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then, whilst (the universe) attains (to its acme through evolution), there will befall the great all-encompassing calamity (the Hour of Resurrection)

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That Day man will retrospect his (every) effort and action

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Hell will be made manifest to everyone who can see

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he who transgressed the limits

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And preferred the life of the world (to the Hereafter)

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Hell will truly be (his) abode

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But as for him who feared standing in the presence of his Lord and forbade (his ill-commanding) self its appetites and lusts

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Paradise will surely be (his) abode

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The disbelievers) ask you about the Hour of Rising: ‘When will it come to pass?

43.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: What should be your concern in talking about (its appointed time)

44.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Its ultimate limit is up to your Lord (i.e., as in the beginning, only Oneness will survive in the end as well)

45.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: You are but a Warner to him who fears it

46.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So the Day when they will see it, they (will feel as if they) did not tarry (in the world) but for one evening or one morning

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: A feeling of uneasiness came upon his (holy) face, and he turned aside his (radiant) face

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Because a blind man approached him (who interrupted his discourse)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what do you know? Perhaps he would be purified (further owing to your attending to him)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Or would accept (your) advice which would provide him benefit (more and more)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But the one who disregards (the Din [Religion)]

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: You administer greater care (for his acceptance of Islam)

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Whereas there is no (burden of) responsibility on you, even if he does not adopt purification (i.e., faith)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And as for him who has (himself) come to you exerting (in pursuit of piousness)

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And he fears (his Lord) as well

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But you are not focusing your attention on him

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O My Esteemed Beloved!) Not so indeed! These (Verses of the Holy Qur’an) are but advice

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The one who seeks may accept it (and learn by heart)

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (They are inscribed) on venerable and revered pages

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Which are exalted (and) purified

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Have come forth) by the hands of emissaries (and scribes)

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who are possessors of eminence (and) embodiments of obedience

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Be cursed (the disbelieving) man! How ungrateful he is

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: From what stuff has Allah created him

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He created him from a sperm drop, then determined his measure along with that (regarding genes and sex)

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then (after structuring, developing and completing it) eased for him the passage (of delivery from the mother’s womb)

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then caused him to die and (buried him) in a grave

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then whenever He wills, He will raise them up (alive again)

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, he (the disobedient man) did not fulfil that (obligatory due) which (Allah) had commanded him

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So man should look at his food (and ponder)

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, We pour down water in torrents

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then We split the earth and tear it asunder

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: We then grow from it grain

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And grapes and vegetables

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the olive and the date palm

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And thickly planted dense gardens

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (a variety of) fruits and (animals’) fodder

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: As provision both for you and your livestock (to live on)

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, when the Deafening Blast comes

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day man will flee from his brother

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And from his mother and his father (too)

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (even) from his wife and his children

37.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day every person will be in such a (dismal) state that will make him unconcerned (with everyone else)

38.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The same Day many faces will be shining (with light)

39.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (They will be) smiling, laughing (and) rejoicing

40.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And numerous faces there will be covered with dust that Day

41.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: These (faces) will be overshadowed with darkness (as well)

42.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They are the people who are disbelievers (and) mischief-mongers (i.e., evildoers)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When the sun will be folded up and extinguished

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the stars will fall (from their galaxies)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the mountains, (after having changed into dust,) will be set in motion (into the atmosphere)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the she-camels heavy with young will be left neglected and discarded (i.e., no one will tend them)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when (fear-stricken) wild beasts will be herded together

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when (all) oceans and rivers will be made to rise and swell

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when souls will be united (with their bodies)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the infant girl buried alive will be asked

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For what crime was she slain

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the records of deeds will be laid open

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the layers of heaven will be torn asunder and moved away from their places

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when (the Fire of) Hell will be burnt ablaze

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when Paradise will be brought up close

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Everyone will come to know what he has brought forth

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So I swear by (the heavenly spheres) which recede (after appearing)

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Which revolve freely, (then) hide (after appearing)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the night when its darkness tapers off

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the morning when its light dawns

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, this (Qur’an) is the Word (communicated) by a glorious and most venerable Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him)

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who is mighty and strong (in calling to the truth, preaching the faith in Messengership and spiritual competence, and) is held in extreme reverence and veneration (and splendour and glory) in the presence of the Lord of the Throne

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Entitled to obligatory obedience (by all the worlds because obedience to him is obedience to Allah) and faithful to His trust (possesses Revelation and all divine secrets of the heavens and the earth)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And, (O people,) he who blesses you with his (holy) companionship (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]) is not mad. (Whatever he communicates is the truth.

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And he has indeed seen (the absolute beauty of the Lord of the Throne) on the effulgent horizon (of the realm of Divinity).

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And he (the glorious Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him]) is not at all miserly in (disclosing) the unseen. (The Lord of the Throne has not left for him any deficiency.

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor is that (Qur’an) the utterance of any accursed Satan

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then, (O you doomed,) where are you going (disregarding such a valuable treasure)

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This (Qur’an) is but admonition (revealed) for all the worlds

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Every one of you who aspires to tread the straight path (can take guidance from this source spring)

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And you can aspire only to what Allah intends, Who is the Sustainer of all the worlds

82.SurahEnglishNames: The Cleaving, The Cleaving Asunder, Bursting Apart

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When (all) the heavenly spheres will be split apart

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the planets will fall and scatter

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when oceans (and rivers) will flood and overflow

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when graves will be overturned

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then everyone will come to know what actions he sent forward and what he left behind

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O man! What has deluded you concerning your Gracious Lord

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The One) Who created you (from a fertiled ovum in the mother’s womb), then, (to structure your limbs at the fetal stage,) He shaped you aright, then brought about proportionate alteration in your constitution

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He constituted you in whatever form He willed

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That is the truth, (but) on the contrary, you deny the Day of Recompense

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Whereas there are guardian angels appointed over you

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Who are) dignified, the scribes (writing the records of all your deeds)

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They know (all) those (actions) which you do

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, the truly good will be in the Garden of Bliss

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And surely, the evildoers will be in the (Blazing Fire of) Hell

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They will enter it on the Day of Rising

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And will never be able to absent themselves from it (Hell)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what have you made out what the Day of Recompense is

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So what have you learnt about what the Day of Recompense is

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is the Day when no soul will own anything for any other soul, and the command on that Day will be entirely Allah’s

83.SurahEnglishNames: Defrauding, The Defrauders, The Cheats, Cheating
