1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to those who give less in measure or weight

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When (they) take by measure from others, they take (from them) full

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when they (themselves) give by measure or weigh to others, they give them less

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Do they not believe that they will be raised up (again after death)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For a Terrible Day

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The Day when all mankind will stand before the Lord of all the worlds

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is true that the record of the evildoers is kept in Sijjin (the ante-chamber of Hell)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what do you know what Sijjin is

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is an inscribed book (set down in the large ante-chamber of the prison of Hell, with the names and evil deeds of every inmate of Hell registered in it)

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to the deniers on that Day

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Those who deny the Day of Recompense

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And no one else denies it except every defiant and sinner

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When Our Revelations are read out to him, he says (or thinks) that (they are) tales of the ancients

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That is not at all (the case); rather (the fact is that the evil deeds) which they earned have rusted their hearts. (The Revelations, therefore, do not move their hearts.

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The truth is that they will be screened off (to deprive them of) the sight of their Lord

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then they will be cast into Hell

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then it will be said to them: ‘This is (the punishment of Hell) which you used to belie.

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: This is (also) true that the record of the truly pious is for sure maintained in ‘Illiyyin (the ante-chamber of Paradise)

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what do you know what ‘Illiyyin is

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is an inscribed book (set down in the large ante-chamber of a lofty mansion of Paradise with the names and pious deeds of those who will be allocated superior stations in Paradise)

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The angels closest (to Allah) remain present here

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, the truly pious, (joyful and glad,) will be in blissful Paradise

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Reclining on couches, enjoying the wonderful sights

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: You will find on their faces the glow and freshness of bliss and delight

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They shall be served with securely sealed delicious and holy beverage

26.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Its seal will be musk. And (it is this beverage which) all aspirants should hastily strive and compete to acquire. (Some seek the drink of bliss whilst others long for the drink of nearness, and still others yearn for the drink of countenance—all will be served according to their respective tastes)

27.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And this (beverage of Paradise) will be mixed with the water of Tasnim

28.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (This Tasnim) is a fountain at which only those drawn close will drink

29.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely (in the worldly life), the evildoers used to ridicule the believers

30.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And winked at one another when they passed by them

31.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when they went back to their families, they used to exult over the believers (by comparing the believers’ destitution and their own affluence) and returned speaking of them with jests

32.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when they (the arrogant people) saw these (the indigent believers), they used to say: ‘They have gone astray,’ (i.e., they have lost the world whilst the Hereafter is nothing but fiction.

33.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yet they had not been sent to watch over their (state of affairs)

34.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So (see) Today the believers are laughing at the disbelievers

35.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Reclining on ornamented couches, they are viewing the sight (comparing their own prosperity and the disbelievers’ impoverishment)

36.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, have the disbelievers been rewarded in full for (the mockery), which they used to inflict upon (the believers)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When (all) the heavenly bodies will split asunder

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And obey the command of their Lord (with regard to the catastrophic split) and (it is this implementation of the command) that they are bound to do

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the earth will be flattened out (after it is broken into dust particles)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And it will cast out all that is inside it and become empty

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (it) will (also) obey the command of its Lord (with regard to the catastrophic split) and (it is this obedience) which it is worthy of

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: O man! You sustain rigours to reach your Lord. Ultimately, you will meet Him

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So as for him who will be given his record in his right hand

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He will soon be given an easy reckoning

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And will return to his family rejoicing

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And as for him who will be given his record behind his back

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He will soon cry out for death

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And he will enter the Blazing Fire of Hell

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, he lived joyfully with his family (in the world)

14.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No doubt, he thought he would never return (to his Lord) for reckoning

15.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Why not! Indeed, his Lord is ever watching him

16.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So I swear by the evening glow (i.e., the twilight or its later glare)

17.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the night and all that it envelops (under its embrace)

18.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the moon when it appears full

19.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: You will assuredly ride along stage by stage

20.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So, what is the matter with them that (even after witnessing the truth of the forecast of the Qur’an), they do not believe

21.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And when the Qur’an is recited to them, they do not fall down prostrate (before Allah)

22.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Instead, the disbelievers (further) deny it

23.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And Allah knows best (the contention and disbelief) which they are piling

24.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So give them the news of a painful punishment

25.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But those who believe and do pious deeds, for them is an unending (i.e., everlasting) reward

85.SurahEnglishNames: The Mansions of the Stars, The Constellations

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By the heaven with its constellations

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the Promised Day

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And by the One Who will be Present (that Day) and by what will be brought to the presence

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The (people) of the trenches were slain

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (The people of) the fierce fire which was (fed) with abundant fuel

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When they sat beside it

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And they are themselves witnesses to all they did to the believers (i.e., casting them into the fire and burning them)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And nothing (of the believers) was annoying them except that they had believed in Allah the Almighty, All-Praiseworthy

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, those who persecute the believing men and women and then do not (even) repent, for them is the punishment of Hell, and for them is (especially) the torment of burning in the Fire

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And indeed, those who believe and keep doing pious deeds, for them are Gardens with streams flowing under them. This is the great victory

12.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Surely, the seizure of your Lord is most severe

13.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Verily, He creates the first time, and He is the One Who will bring to life the second time

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And man (bewildered and baffled) will say: ‘What has happened to her?

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day, she will herself bring to light her experiences

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: For your Lord will have made subservient to her (the symbolic language of) sharp signals

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: On that Day, people will form up in different groups, (in diverse conditions,) so that they may be shown their works

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then he who will have done even an atom’s weight of good will see it

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And he who will have done even an atom’s weight of evil will (also) see it

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By the charging horses that gallop (in the battlefield) and pant

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And those that produce sparks striking their hoofs on rocks

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then they attack (the enemy) at dawn

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And then raise clouds of dust from the point (of attack)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And then simultaneously pierce into (the enemy) ranks

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, man is most ungrateful to his Lord

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And verily, he is himself a witness to this ingratitude

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And indeed, he is quite stubborn in his love of wealth

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But does he not know when those (dead) in the graves will be raised

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And secrets which are in hearts will be disclosed

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, their Lord will be Well Aware of their (deeds) on that Day

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: The high-scale jolt rocking (the whole universe of the heavens and the earth) and thunder

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what is that high-scale jolt rocking (everything) and that thunder

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what have you made out what the high-scale jolt and thunder implies

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It implies) the Day of Resurrection when (the whole of) mankind will become like scattered moths

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And the mountains will be like multicoloured carded wool

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So he whose scales of deeds in the balance will be heavy

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He will be in luxury and delight

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: But as for him whose scales of deeds in the balance will be light

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: His abode will be Hawiya (a pit in Hell)

10.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what have you made out what that (Hawiya) is

11.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: It is (an extremely deep pit of) the fiercely Blazing Fire (of Hell)

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Your greed for massive wealth and the superiority complex has made you negligent (of the Hereafter)

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Until you go down to the graves

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: No indeed! You will soon learn (this reality that wealth and riches will avail you nothing)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Again (you are warned.) No! Never! You will soon learn about (your end)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Yes indeed! Would that you knew with the knowledge of certitude (the consequence of greed for wealth and riches and your negligence! Then, lost in the worldly pleasures, you would never forget the Hereafter like this)

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Consequent on your greed) you will surely see Hell

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then you will certainly see it with the eye of certitude

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then on that Day, you will certainly be questioned about the bounties (given to you by Allah and the way you consumed them)

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By the passing time (whose rotation bears witness to the affairs of mankind). Or By the Prayer of declining day (‘Asr, for this Prayer is the middle of all Prayers). Or By the declining time of the day, (when the sun, after shining for the whole day, presents the sight of its setting). Or By the holy era of the Prophethood of Muhammad (blessings and peace be upon him), the sole objective and the most coveted achievement of all ages historic as well as pre-historic, and of all times to come

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, man is at a loss (for he is losing his valuable lifetime)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Except for those who believe and do good deeds and exhort one another to truth and exhort one another to patience (in the face of hardships and afflictions that are faced whilst preaching the Din [Religion] of truth)

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Woe to everyone who slanders (face to face) and finds fault (in absence)

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (Woe to him) who accumulates wealth and keeps counting it

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He thinks that his riches will keep him alive forever

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: By no means! He will certainly be cast into al-Hutama (the crushing up Fire)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And what will make you understand what al-Hutama (the crushing up Fire) is

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (It) is a Fire kindled by Allah

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: That will rise over the hearts (with its torture)

8.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, that (Fire) will be closed upon them all around

9.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: In towering columns (of fierce flames and they will not find any way to escape)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with those who had elephants

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Did He not thwart their crafty designs

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And He sent on to them (ambient) swarms of birds

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Which pelted them with stone-hard slugs

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then (Allah made them perish) like chewed-up chaff

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: To awake drive amongst the Quraysh

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: They were acclimatized to the summer and winter (commercial) trips

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So they should worship the Lord of this (Sacred) House (Ka‘ba, to give Him thanks)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who has fed them in hunger (i.e., provided them sustenance in starving conditions) and secured them from fear (of foes i.e., blessed them with secure and peaceful life)

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Have you seen him who denies the Din (Religion)

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So he is the one who pushes away the orphan (i.e., rejects the needs of the orphans and deprives them of their right)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And does not promote the cause of feeding the poor (i.e., does not strive to end the economic exploitation of the poor and the needy)

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So woe to those worshippers

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who are unaware of (the spirit of) their Prayers (i.e., they are mindful only of the rights of Allah, but are heedless of the rights of fellow human beings)

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who show off (their worship, for they only render a formal service to the Creator and are inconsiderate to the oppressed humanity)

7.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And who refuse to lend a worthless small object of use even on demand

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, We have bestowed on you an infinite abundance (every kind of superiority, bliss and bounty).

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice (a token of gratitude)

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Indeed, your enemy will remain childless and his race will be cut off

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Say: ‘O disbelievers

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: I do not worship those (idols) that you worship

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor do you worship (the Lord) Whom I worship

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And I shall never worship those (idols) that you worship

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor will you (ever) worship (the Lord) Whom I worship

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (So) you have your din (religion), and I have my Din (Religion).

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: When there comes Allah’s help and victory

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And you see people joining Allah’s Din (Religion) in droves

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Then glorify Allah’s praise (in gratitude), exalting Him, and beg Him (humbly) for pardon. Surely, He is Ever-Relenting and Oft-Returning (with evermore compassion)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Perished be the two hands of Abu Lahab and be he perished himself (he has pointed his finger to Our Beloved)

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Neither His (inherited) wealth nor his earned riches have given him any benefit

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Soon he will tumble into the Flaming Fire

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And his (damned, wretched) wife (too) who carries (on her head) the burden of (thorny) twigs (and spreads them in the way of Our Beloved, to injure the holy soles of his feet)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Around her neck will be (the same) palm-fibre rope (she uses to bind the bunch of thorny twigs)

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: (O Esteemed Messenger!) Proclaim: ‘He is Allah, Who is the One

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Allah is the Transcendent of all, the Protector and Far-Superior to all

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: He has not begotten any, nor is He begotten

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Nor is there anyone equal to Him.

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Beseech: ‘I seek refuge with the Lord of daybreak (or Who brought the universe into existence with an explosion extremely fast)

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: From the evil influence (and harmfulness) of everything that He has created

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And (in particular) from the evil of the murky night when (its) darkness prevails

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And from the evil of those women (and men) who practise magic on knots by blowing

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: And from the mischief of every envious person when he envies.

1.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Beseech: ‘I seek refuge with the Lord of (the whole of) mankind

2.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who is the King of (all) mankind

3.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who is the God of the (whole) human race

4.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: From the evil of the slinking whisperer (Satan) who hides himself withdrawing (from the influence of Allah’s remembrance)

5.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Who whispers into the hearts of mankind

6.Dr. Mohammad Tahir-ul-Qadri: Whether he (the whispering Satan) comes from the jinn or mankind.
